subject: Fashion
title: Byzantine Silk Trade
description: A fast breakdown of Byzantine Silk Trade for builders.

hook.text: Two monks smuggled silkworm eggs inside hollow bamboo canes. They changed an empire.

buildup.text: China guarded its silk monopoly for centuries. Exporting silkworm eggs was punishable by death.

discovery.text: Emperor Justinian sent monks to China around 550 AD. They returned with the stolen secret.

twist.text: Byzantium then hoarded silk production just like China hadâ€”banning exports to rival states.

climax.text: Silk became Byzantium's weapon. Trade embargoes in fabric weakened enemies without armies.

punchline.text: The greatest heist in fashion was pulled off by monks.

quiz.question: How did the Byzantine Empire break China's silk monopoly?
options: They developed a synthetic alternative to silk
Monks smuggled silkworm eggs out of China in hollow canes
